website_summaries.verdict: With 5 different settings, this wooden slant board will give you just the angle you need to loosen up tight calves.
cons: May be too heavy for some customers to lift comfortably

customer_reviews.title: Healthy again
customer_reviews.text: I was plagued with patella tendonitis for months and after one week of doing squats on this slant board my problem was gone. Doctor and my pt could not help me. I'm amazed! Thanks
customer_reviews.author: peter

customer_reviews.title: This is the way to construct a slant board
customer_reviews.text: First and foremost your dimensions are how EVERY slant board should be constructed. I had to return a competitors because they do not know how make one. The longest dimension should correspond to how a person's foot will be placed on the board. On the fact of dimensional appropriateness, Great job. The stretch angles are very appropriate for those not affected by joint mobility issues. Durability appears to be solid thus far, time will tell the whole story. Two facets I would like added are a carrying cutout and locks to secure the board. The lack of those features is not something an interested buyer should balk at. This board works well to stretch the calf.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great for use in physical therapy
customer_reviews.text: When I was in physical therapy healing an issue with my leg I noticed this slant board and decided to purchase one for home use. A great decision and the right product to do exactly what I needed. This slant board is very well made. The wood is thick and sturdy and adjusts to practically any angle you could possibly use. The material covering the part of the board where you step on is very grippy to ensure a stable position. Being large I have found this board can hold my weight easily and surely. Great device for home therapy.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Borges

customer_reviews.title: If it's good enough for my physical therapist, it's good enough for me
customer_reviews.text: It does pretty much exactly what it says it. I bought one after my physical therapist recommend I do so, but I was shocked when the one I received was exactly the same as a professional physical therapy unit uses. Highly recommended for people with Achilles and ankle issues or professional athletes.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Brownson

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I have insertional Achilles tendinitis. Have had the surgery in one foot and am starting to have the same issue in the other foot. Very sturdy, well made and should last a long time. As good or better than the one they have at my physical therapist’s office. If you need to stretch your feet this is the one you need
customer_reviews.author: Brent Railey

customer_reviews.title: Too large for some uses/users
customer_reviews.text: This was much too large to use as a calf stretcher unless you stand on it completely. Also, the board does not touch the floor, which also keeps you from getting a good stretch while keeping your feet on the floor. I have balance and mobility issues, so that did not work for me and I returned the product. However, for what it is it is probably good - hence I only took off one star.
customer_reviews.author: Gott's Kind

customer_reviews.title: A Solid Slant Board
customer_reviews.text: This is a well built slant board that will remain stable while being used. I weigh 190 lbs and it supports me just fine. It is quite heavy, however, so use caution when picking it up from the floor. The adjustments cover all angles one would need, and changing angles is simple.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is definitely sturdy and I like the fact that it is adjustable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the calf board so I can continue my knee rehab at home post surgery. It is definitely sturdy and I like the fact that it is adjustable. While it costs more $, this product is definitely better than one of those blue plastic calf stretch devices. This product allows you to really focus on a deep stretch and provides the stability to hold a stretch for an extended period of time. Minor annoyance that the black grip that covers the top is just starting to peel up in the corner, but this is very easily fixed. Good product....definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Just like the one at PT
customer_reviews.text: I started PT after surgery on the medial meniscus of my right knee. The therapist has me using a board just like this at each session. It feels so good to stretch my calves, I decided to get my own. This one has a non-slip surface that will definitely keep you in place, and adjusts to many slants for comfort. I put mine pointing toward a wall so I have something to lean on, but if you have good balance, you might not need that extra support.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fixes Patellar Tendinitis
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product; it is well-built, easily supports my 200lbs and has significantly improved my patellar tendinitis. After one week of use, doing 3sets of 15 repetitions twice daily, the pain in my knee is almost all gone. My knee is significantly improved; it has improved to such an extent that I have to force myself not to jump right back into all my regular activity (e.g., running, jumping, high intensity interval training). If you are having knee problems related to patellar tendinitis, this is the product for you.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: Very solid quality product. Great for stretching out calves and soleus muscles. Had it for about a year when the black sandpaper started peeling off the top, contacted Liberty to see how to fix and they immediately sent me an entire new board, no questions asked. Phenomenal customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: For son with cerebral palsy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son who has mild spastic diplegia cerebral palsy. He needs to stretch a lot and this is perfect. He uses something similar to this in therapy. I have been using it too because it gives such a good stretch in your legs. I bought this one specifically because it is adjustable. It is heavy and bulky, though. Just something to keep in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Dena

customer_reviews.title: ... supports my total body weight and its lightweight - easy to travel
customer_reviews.text: this board does provide stretch but it was too big and too heavy for me to handle often - I am a woman in my 60's and opted for the anti-slip Strong Tek portable slant board - its plastic but supports my total body weight and its lightweight - easy to travel with
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: WOrks as promised
customer_reviews.text: I love the stretch I get from this board. I used one of these when I went to PT and wanted one for home and this one fits the bill. I don't get muscles cramps like I did started using the board and that is a wonderful feeling.
customer_reviews.author: Mosey

customer_reviews.title: Good stretch
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been using stairs and a homemade slant board to stretch before his runs. They have a slant board at the rec center where I work out and decided to purchase one for him to use at home. So far it has been great. A much better stretch for his achilles, ankles, calves and up through the legs than stairs. It is as described on product page with adjustable angles and surface. When I have used it there hasn't been an issue with sturdiness and he says he likes it.
customer_reviews.author: katy ericson

customer_reviews.title: Non stick pads come unglued
customer_reviews.text: The product works great and as advertised that said that within the first day the no skid pads on the surface fell off. I now need to wear some shoes with traction to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: The slant board is will made and is just what ...
customer_reviews.text: The slant board is will made and is just what I was looking for to stretch muscle groups in my legs. In just a few short days it is helping my achilles tendonitis. Don’t wait until you get hurt; use it preventively while you are healthy. However, it would have been most helpful if the instructions were clearer, more specific and augmented with images.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Rossein

customer_reviews.title: My calves needed this!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many ways to stretch my calves without great results, but this seems like the best solution I've found. Feels well-built and gives a great stretch. Lets your legs stay relaxed while stretching. I'm already feeling some improvement after just a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan B

customer_reviews.title: Good value but materials not as durable as other slant boards.
customer_reviews.text: Let me start off by saying that it does what it’s supposed to do. Overall, it’s a good product for the price. I debated between this and the Fitter First slant board. This has more angles to stand on. It’s a lot clunkier and not as easy to move from room to room as the Fitter First slant board. It’s also harder to store since it doesn’t collapse completely. The materials on this slant board are not as durable. The particle board scratched easily and it’s starting to break off. The grip tape is also low quality. It’s already starting to rub off. Overall, I recommend it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: JA

customer_reviews.title: Slant Board
customer_reviews.text: I got this board because I just finished Physical Therapy for 3 broken bones in my foot. I have to continue to do the exercises though, they used a slant board in therapy, it really helps to stretch the calf muscles which surround the ankle, so I decided this would be good. I like that it is adjustable. Well made. Would recommend .
customer_reviews.author: Sharen A. Kirkham

customer_reviews.title: Really well made.
customer_reviews.text: I love this board. It is adjustable and works great to help stretch my aching muscles.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Miller

customer_reviews.title: I use a similar Slant Board at my PT. Now I use everyday.  Very Sturdy!!
customer_reviews.text: Wooden, Adjustable Incline Board & Calf Stretcher. It's very Sturdy & Well Made!! Easily set up the incline - 5 positions 15°, 20°, 25°, 30° and 35°!! I use it everyday, it's a valuable addition to my Home PT Exercise Equipment!! Yes, I Recommend this Product!!
customer_reviews.author: PZ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a well built and study product. Stretches the calf nicely and is safe at all angles.
customer_reviews.author: alie16

customer_reviews.title: Must have for PT at home!
customer_reviews.text: Durable. The same as what I used at my physical therapist office. Great to keep up with your PT or just stretches in general. Excellent quality. Everyone in the house uses before sports activities now. :)
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great for deep leg stretch
customer_reviews.text: Great for getting deep leg stretch. Bottom rough and scratches wood floor until I realized and put a mat down.
customer_reviews.author: lnaley

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy construction. It is very similar to the one ...
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy construction. It is very similar to the one my physical therapist uses at their PT office. I love this and it really helps stretch my calves. I have very bad knees and this board is saving me! Thank you for making it affordable! For the price this is a must have!!!
customer_reviews.author: martha hengels

customer_reviews.title: Quality slant board and grip on entire surface area
customer_reviews.text: Works great and I like that the grip pads are in the entire surface area and not just strips like other brands. You won’t slip while using this.
customer_reviews.author: Craig F

customer_reviews.title: So I am selling this on amazon and I purchased instead a better product from Relax the back
customer_reviews.text: Too heavy so I removed the wood on the side and it is still too heavy. So I am selling this on amazon and I purchased instead a better product from Relax the back.
customer_reviews.author: Clay Gate

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Great addition to the home gym. I think it helps with my plantar fasciitis as well. Really helps stretch all those foot muscles and tendons and the calves as well of course
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I wish slant boards were not so expensive, but I bought this board to help me get rid of the Patellar Tendonitis I have been dealing with for the past year. The board is sturdy and has good grip. Time will tell if this purchase fixes my problem.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: but I was thoroughly pleased with the build and quality when it arrived
customer_reviews.text: Was a little skeptical since it didn't have any reviews when I purchased it, but I was thoroughly pleased with the build and quality when it arrived. It is very sturdy and the grip tape works great. The adjustable angles are perfect. About $30 cheaper then the other wooden boards but it doesn't show it at all. Definitely much better than the flimsy plastic ones.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B. Pfannkuch

customer_reviews.title: Well made, solidly built and adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Product is extremely well built and is helping me get over a tendinitis injury and should prevent a new injury. A lot of choice on the degree of incline which is great. Now my husband is using it and raving about it also. This is the best stretch product we have ever seen. Great quality and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Andi F.

customer_reviews.title: Much better with a board than leaning into a wall or ...
customer_reviews.text: Used a slant board in physical therapy for Achilles tendinitis. Much better with a board than leaning into a wall or using a fat book. This board is nice and sturdy. The ability to adjust the angle is very helpful to get the right amount of stretch. A key component is the black traction surface that prevents your feet from slipping. Seems to be holding up OK but hope it doesn't peel off or wear down.
customer_reviews.author: LHM

customer_reviews.title: Good board, overpriced
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good product. I like that it has adjustable angles. Also like that it doesn’t have a lip like all the plastic ones seem to have. I would give it five stars if it weren’t overpriced by at least $20.
customer_reviews.author: KC1764

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced and well made.
customer_reviews.text: Love the slant board. It’s sturdy, and not unattractive. My physical therapist suggested I use one daily to stretch my calf muscles, so I didn’t want to have to keep it in a closet someplace. It’s perfectly happy out on the open in my sewing room...making it a good reminder to actually use it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen P. Brattin

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this board to anyone with those ailments
customer_reviews.text: Works really well for me. I weigh 260 and have a heel spur and scar tissue from an Achilles tendon tear. This board has helped eliminate the pain and mobility limitations from those conditions. I highly recommend this board to anyone with those ailments.
customer_reviews.author: buckeye55+

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality and Easy to Use!
customer_reviews.text: This is a top-notch quality slant board. I am impressed with how sturdy it is, how well it works, and how it's not at all skimpy in size. Beautifully built and fabulous. And, I'm not embarrassed to leave it out in my living room, although it will slide easily under the sofa.
customer_reviews.author: KathyS

customer_reviews.title: This is a great slant board.
customer_reviews.text: This adjustable incline slant board is perfect for stretching my calves and the backs of my knees to alleviate plantar faciitis and knee pain. I love having the five positions so that I can choose the one most effective for me. It is very sturdy and I feel very safe on it. I highly recommend this model.
customer_reviews.author: virginia

customer_reviews.title: I wanted one for myself and I'm so happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: I'm a nurse who is always on her feet, after knee surgery I started using a slant board at Physical Therapy. I wanted one for myself and I'm so happy with this product. Its sturdy yet easy to pick and take with you or slide under furniture. It's gives your calfs and the back of your legs and incredible stretch. It's now an integral part of my stretching routine either for work or after the gym. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta P.

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely makes my legs feel so much better! Love it especially first thing in the morning and just before bed. Recommending all the time to my friends!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Blessed relief for tight calf muscles!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I put off buying it forever because I was going to build one myself, but eventually realized that was never going to happen. So I bought this one and I am glad I did. It is sturdy, easily adjusts to different angles so that my wife and I can both use it at the angles that work best for us. If I had a complaint it would be that the grippy surface on the slanting board means I can't get away with using it while wearing socks. But that's just laziness on my part.
customer_reviews.author: Artemus Jones

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: nothing to complain about, its solid and has no problems at all
customer_reviews.author: corey l schweitzer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for stretching and doing ATG squats and these things are FANTASTIC!! Highly recommended and worth the money. Even bought one for my office haha!! -Ryan Hannon
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Hannon

customer_reviews.title: Well made, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I just got this slantboard. It is well made and the grips are solid. It is very easy to change the incline angle. Definitely would buy again, but this should last me forever or close to it!
customer_reviews.author: LoraL

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, multifunctional
customer_reviews.text: I've only been using this for a week but I'm super impressed so far. The quality is obvious even before you use it. I love that its so adjustable. I get a great workout from it and it's much better than what you'd get from a simple step block. The balancing aspect works your core which I love. Its also really nice for tight calves, Achilles and hamstrings.
customer_reviews.author: Natalien

customer_reviews.title: Well built slant board!
customer_reviews.text: Great product and nice seller. Product was new as promised, and arrived on time! It is a very durable slant board, and the grip material holds my shoes on well so you feel steady and do not slide off of it! It is adjustable and well built. Very happy with this purchase. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: L.A.

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT
customer_reviews.text: Very SOLID and functional piece. Gets a lot of use in our household. Especially helpful for strengthening my patellar tendons, by squatting with toes "downhill" on the slope of the box. Positive Results!
customer_reviews.author: William R.

customer_reviews.title: The 5 STAR RATING is Entirely Accurate
customer_reviews.text: This is a durable, yet light weight calf stretcher that can be used for more advanced exercises as well. It is well made and was packaged well for shipping. I believe this will last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using my slant board for a couple months now. It is sturdy, stable, adjusts easily and is non-slip. My ability to stretch my legs and ankles have improved. I recommend. I didn't rate durability as I've only had for a couple months, but I'm sure it will be OK
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: The product is adjustable and can be used for a variety of exercises. We all use it!👍
customer_reviews.text: My 15 year old son is plagued by tight calf muscles. So he has physical therapy (PT) in order to assist with what we have been told Sever's Disease. A growth issue for young athletes. PT utilizes this product as a big part of their stretching method. We were very please to come across something thats well built and for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Ward

customer_reviews.title: This slant board is just like the ones at physical therapy
customer_reviews.text: This slant board is just like the ones at physical therapy. If you go to physical therapy for a knee replacement or knee surgery and want to continue your rehab at home, this will help you.
customer_reviews.author: ron

customer_reviews.title: Nicley crafted slant board
customer_reviews.text: Attractive-looking, durable wood slant board. Adjustable for a wide range of slopes with a good non-slip surface. Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Maia

customer_reviews.title: In-home stretching and therapy for plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I suffer from plantar fasciitis and need to stretch calf muscles. This is pretty much a duplicate to the one I use in therapy. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: W. Jane Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for stretching.
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought this. Great for stretching tight calves. No assembly, ready to use. Non-slip top is great.
customer_reviews.author: Farm Girl

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I am doing PT for Achilles' tendonitis. This slant board is perfect. It is sturdy and well made. The non slip surface is useful and keeps your feet from sliding. You can adjust the angle depending on how much you want to stretch the calf muscle and tendon. I use it 3 times per day. Very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Skip McQuillin

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome, a great variety of degrees for increasing/decreasing stretching ...
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome, a great variety of degrees for increasing/decreasing stretching range. Very sturdy and my feet grip to the tape well.
customer_reviews.author: Icehockey2

customer_reviews.title: Great for plantar fasciitis stretch
customer_reviews.text: bought 2 of these- 1 for house other for office so i can stretch my foot throughout the day to ease plantar fasciitis pain. super durable and the adjustable angle is exactly what i needed. very good quality construction with the slip free foot surface.
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to Any Athlete's Injury Prevention Arsenal.
customer_reviews.text: This board is a great addition to any distance runner's collection of physical therapy equipment. I use it right after a run to stretch out my calves, and will use it throughout the day to keep them stretched and limber. Love the variable slope options as well. Sturdy build and aesthetically appealing - like a Nordic styled accessory for your home.
customer_reviews.author: Kevan Huston

customer_reviews.title: PRODUCT REVIEW
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tool for calve stretch after going through total knee replacement surgery... after my recovery I'll continue using it...
customer_reviews.author: lui

customer_reviews.title: Quality slant board!
customer_reviews.text: This slant board is perfect! Just what I needed to continue my physical therapy at home. The non-slip step top and multiple degrees of incline are why I chose this slant board. I was impressed with how well made it was!
customer_reviews.author: Carmine E.

customer_reviews.title: Great product; worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I expected. I've used it know for a few weeks and it performs well.
customer_reviews.author: Zdzislaw Nagengast

customer_reviews.title: I have plantar faciatis and my therapist recommended it and I am in love
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar faciatis and my therapist recommended it and I am in love, I use twice a day and sometimes three and the pain is a lot less. Buy you one too!
customer_reviews.author: Rebeca Illescas

customer_reviews.title: Recovery
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by my physical therapist after breaking my tibia fibula. best piece of equipment I invested in!
customer_reviews.author: Sandrine Pieray

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what it described. My husband is very happy with it. The adjustable levels is great.
customer_reviews.author: C Smith

customer_reviews.title: So easy and convenient, I actually use it
customer_reviews.text: This product was recommended by my physical therapist and was a good buy. It is well-made. I keep it by my TV and use it every day to stretch calf and hamstring muscles. The only "trick" is that you have to wear shoes to use it. (don't try to use it wearing only socks).
customer_reviews.author: A. D. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great for ankle rehabilitation
customer_reviews.text: I recently finished physical therapy and need to continue my therapy at home. Used a board like this one at PT, and it was one of my favorite and most useful exercises. Glad I found this one so I can keep improving. Fast shipping, great product.
customer_reviews.author: A Busy Mom

customer_reviews.title: Grip easily torn
customer_reviews.text: The grip tore right off only after 1.5 weeks of use :(
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Bartole

customer_reviews.title: A must have for anyone seeking a deeper stretch
customer_reviews.text: I first used one of these when I was in therapy for a torn meniscus in my knee. It gives amazing stretch for your hamstring. This one is exactly like the one I used in therapy. It is solid, well made and worth every cent.
customer_reviews.author: Emma Ware

customer_reviews.title: Great for stretching the calves, hams and Achilles!
customer_reviews.text: I use this contraption at physical therapy and decided to get one for the house. Well made, sturdy product and supports weight well.
customer_reviews.author: BayouMagnolia

customer_reviews.title: Quick Delivery
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and easy to move. Helps with stretching and strengthening muscles around my knee. Had partial meniscus surgery six months ago and this helps me recover from runs.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Forcey

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing, I use it for stretching and eccentric squats. Love how adjustable it is.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: This is a well made quality product.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to spend this much for a slant board, but this product is well worth it. It's well made and looks like it's going to last for many years. It was packaged well and arrived promptly in excellent condition.
customer_reviews.author: Betty B.

customer_reviews.title: This board works great. My husband and I both use it daily ...
customer_reviews.text: This board works great. My husband and I both use it daily and the adjustable heights works for both of us. It's non slippery and feel very safe while using. I would recommend this board. Excellent choice!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Pain Relief
customer_reviews.text: This is the same stand as the one I used at physical therapy. I have foot and knee problems and get quite a bit of relief with this. I use the two lowest slant settings.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: The slant board is well made and nicely finished, and is very sturdy. I would very highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Computer Prof

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE the slant board
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE the slant board. At first I was concerned the angle was not going to be high enough- the other readers assured me it would be perfect and they were right. It is very well made. It is non skid and has more angles than I probably ever need. It was a great buy. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: lainey

customer_reviews.title: Great for stretching calves.
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I was introduced to this as part of my physical therapy. It is also in my Dressage training. The equipment is well constructed and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: S. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Want a healthy back, you need this!
customer_reviews.text: High quality , great price and fast shipping! My husband uses this to get his back in line and stretch his calves.He was sceptic at first , but now he really appreciates how he feels after he uses it.
customer_reviews.author: amazon fan

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Very sturdy. Doesn’t slide.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Not particle board which is nice. The black grip is really grippy. It’s a little smaller than I thought. Not a big issues but it seemed bigger in the photos. I’m 5’9” 125lbs. If you’re doing pistols then you’re fine, but 2 legged things you’ll need to stand a little closer together.
customer_reviews.author: F. Gin

customer_reviews.title: Gives my thighs and calves a good stretch. I jump on it a few times ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after hip replacement surgery after trying it at physical therapy. Gives my thighs and calves a good stretch. I jump on it a few times a day for a few minutes and it has helped my recovery a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Good calf stretcher
customer_reviews.text: It just what I wanted to use at home, outside of the gym. The easy way to change the angles is a nice tool.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Gafke

customer_reviews.title: Very good product. Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. Exactly what I wanted. I like how sturdy it is.
customer_reviews.author: Charley

customer_reviews.title: It is very useful since I have plantar fasciitis and my husband just ...
customer_reviews.text: It is very useful since I have plantar fasciitis and my husband just had a knee replacement. We use it every day and it is a integral part of our living room. It is sturdy and well built. I like that is adjustable and slip proof.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia J. Lytle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent slant board
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the slant board to help rehab a knee issue and this has been perfect. It is sturdy, well made and has a nice grip surface. The adjustable slant levels are easy to change. Highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: outsideD

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Well Made
customer_reviews.text: Really great! Has helped my plantar fasciitis. Well made and sturdy. I like the added exercises that can be done beyond simply standing on it.
customer_reviews.author: NICOLE L.

customer_reviews.title: Safety
customer_reviews.text: I am using the slant board on a daily basis; it meets my expections...safe to use.
customer_reviews.author: Veronika Gorsuch

customer_reviews.title: ... definitely for my Achilles tendinitis It truly has been great I do the exercises at least three times a ...
customer_reviews.text: My trainer suggested to get this definitely for my Achilles tendinitis It truly has been great I do the exercises at least three times a day and it has made a world of difference Worth every cent.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Brogna

customer_reviews.title: PT Office Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this slant board. Sturdy and minimal set-up. A great tool in helping my legs stretch/recover from running.

customer_reviews.title: Well made, great value.
customer_reviews.text: Well made product. Heavy & solid. The adjustable feature is what sold me. Very pleased.

customer_reviews.title: Love this Slant Board!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great way to stretch your calves and feet. It has really helped my plantar fascitis.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Product
customer_reviews.text: Product is large enough to accommodate stretching of the leg muscles on both legs simultaneously.

customer_reviews.title: Durability and Adjustability
customer_reviews.text: Well built and adjustability is important for the use by several clients. I would recommend it for anyone who wishes to stretch out their gastroc muscles.

customer_reviews.title: Great to have at home
customer_reviews.text: This slant board is wonderful to have at home; it's just like the one at my physical therapist's office. I use it daily.

customer_reviews.title: Just like the one used at physical therapy
customer_reviews.text: The slant board is like the one I used during my visits to a see physical therapist. The stretches on the slant board that my physical therapist prescribed are used to help treat plantar fasciitis. I use the slant board at home to further my progress I made during my visits.
customer_reviews.author: A B D

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Adjustable Slant Board
customer_reviews.text: I really like this slant board-- feels sturdy. The only thing I wish is that there was some sort of non-slip material for wood floors.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product, Fast Shipping
customer_reviews.text: Using this for calf stretches and it is excellent. The product is very well built, solid, and very easy to adjust the slant angle. Also, I received it a day sooner than the projected date. Very happy.

customer_reviews.text: I use it daily. Helps keep my feet stretched out post injury/surgery. Very helpful.

product_meta.title: Liberty Imports Professional Wooden Slant Board, Adjustable Incline Calf Stretch Slantboard with Full Non-Slip Surface, 16 inches x 12.5 inches, 5 Positions (350 LB Capacity)
feature_bullets: ✅ OPTIMAL STRETCH | Multi-purpose professional wood slant board with anti-slip safety treads to improve strength and conditioning for all ages and all body types. Designed for the rehabilitation of Achilles tendon injuries, shin splints, calf strains and other lower leg injuries. Also stimulates your core and improves your agility, reaction time, strength and stamina.

✅ QUICK-ADJUST INCLINE | This highly durable and stable board features a quick-adjust locking system that lets you adjust the stretch angle between 5 positions 15°, 20°, 25°, 30° and 35°. Set up the incline that fits your personal need. Board measures 16" (Deep) X 12.5" (Wide) X 10" (High). Also serves as a perfect standing desk accessory.

✅ FULL NON-SLIP SURFACE | Features a full easy-grip surface that’s gentle on bare feet but helps keep you in place safely and securely. The slant board can be used for a variety of stretching exercises focusing on particular parts of the anatomy of your legs. It helps you get the most out of your workout and also helps prevent injury.

✅ STRONG STABLE BASE | Heavy duty reinforced wood with long-lasting strength, durability and capacity of 350 Lbs. The slant board has found its way into many homes, gyms, clinics and physiotherapy units. Always ensure that you maintain a proper posture through the slant board exercise.

✅ PHYSICAL THERAPY EQUIPMENT | Ideal for lower leg injuries rehabilitation, flexibility & strength enhancement. Daily stretching can also reduce knee pain and help recover from Patellar Tendonitis. Suitable for beginners and veteran athletes and all body types. Comes fully assembled and ready to use out of box. Exercise guide included.
